content: अभिपत् {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> {@--1@} To fly near, go or hasten near, approach; हंतुमभिपतति पांडुसुतं <ls>Ki. 12. 36</ls>; अधिरोढुमस्तगिरिमभ्यपतत् <ls>Śi. 9. 1</ls>; <ls>Dk. 72</ls>, <ls n="Dk.">128</ls>; <ls>Mk. 9. 12</ls>; <ls>Ki. 10. 42.</ls> {@--2@} To fall upon, attack, assail; यंता गजस्याभ्यपतद्गजस्थं <ls>R. 7. 37</ls>; <ls>Dk. 62</ls>, <ls n="Dk.">70</ls>, <ls n="Dk.">96</ls>; <ls>Ki. 7. 19.</ls> {@--3@} To fall down, fall (as tears). {@--4@} To fall into, enter or come into. {@--5@} To overtake in flying. {@--6@} To pass over, traverse. {@--7@} To get, back, withdraw, retire; <ls>Śi. 7. 51</ls>; <ls>Ki. 10. 54.</ls> {@--8@} (4A.) To be lord or master of (<ab>Ved.</ab>). {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} To throw upon, throw down into; ज्वलनमभिपातयामि <ls>Ve. 6.</ls>
